   19: %%
   20: -module(dbg_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Test functions
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   24:          groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   25: -export([big/1, tiny/1, simple/1, message/1, distributed/1, port/1,
   26: 	 send/1, recv/1,
   27:          ip_port/1, file_port/1, file_port2/1, file_tracer/1,
   28:          ip_port_busy/1, wrap_port/1, wrap_port_time/1,
   29:          with_seq_trace/1, dead_suspend/1, local_trace/1,
   30:          saved_patterns/1, tracer_exit_on_stop/1,
   31:          erl_tracer/1, distributed_erl_tracer/1]).
   32: -export([tracee1/1, tracee2/1]).
   33: -export([dummy/0, exported/1]).
   34: -export([enabled/3, trace/5, load_nif/1]).
   35: 
   36: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [{group, global}].
   44: 
   45: groups() ->
   46:     [{global,[],[{group, tests}]},
   47:      {tests,[],[
   48:                 big, tiny, simple, message, distributed, port, ip_port,
   49:                 send, recv,
   50:                 file_port, file_port2, file_tracer, ip_port_busy,
   51:                 wrap_port, wrap_port_time, with_seq_trace, dead_suspend,
   52:                 local_trace, saved_patterns, tracer_exit_on_stop,
   53:                 erl_tracer, distributed_erl_tracer]}].
   54: 
   55: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   59:     dbg:stop(),
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: %% Rudimentary interface test
   69: big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     {ok,OldCurDir} = file:get_cwd(),
   71:     Datadir=proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   72:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   73:     ok=file:set_cwd(Privdir),
   74:     try
   75:         %% make sure dbg is stopped (and returns correctly)
   76:         ok = dbg:stop(),
   77: 
   78:         %% compile test module and make sure it is loaded.
   79:         {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Datadir++"/dbg_test",[trace]),
   80:         code:purge(dbg_test),
   81:         {module, Mod}=code:load_file(dbg_test),
   82: 
   83:         %% run/debug a named test function.
   84:         Pid = spawn_link(dbg_test, loop, [Config]),
   85:         true = register(dbg_test_loop, Pid),
   86:         {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(),
   87:         {ok,[{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(dbg_test_loop, [m,p,c]),
   88:         ok = dbg:c(dbg_test, test, [Config]),
   89:         ok = dbg:i(),
   90:         dbg_test_loop ! {dbg_test, stop},
   91:         unregister(dbg_test_loop),
   92:         ok = dbg:stop(),
   93: 
   94:         %% run/debug a Pid.
   95:         Pid2=spawn_link(dbg_test,loop,[Config]),
   96:         {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(),
   97:         {ok,[{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Pid2,[s,r,p]),
   98:         ok = dbg:c(dbg_test, test, [Config]),
   99:         ok = dbg:i(),
  100:         Pid2 ! {dbg_test, stop},
  101: 
  102:         ok=file:set_cwd(OldCurDir)
  103:     after
  104:         dbg:stop()
  105:     end,
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: 
  109: %% Rudimentary interface test
  110: tiny(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  111:     {ok,OldCurDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  112:     Datadir=proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  113:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  114:     ok=file:set_cwd(Privdir),
  115:     try
  116:         %% compile test module and make sure it is loaded.
  117:         {ok, Mod} = compile:file(Datadir++"/dbg_test",[trace]),
  118:         code:purge(dbg_test),
  119:         {module, Mod}=code:load_file(dbg_test),
  120: 
  121:         Pid=spawn_link(dbg_test,loop,[Config]),
  122:         if
  123:             is_pid(Pid) ->
  124:                 dbg:tracer(),
  125:                 {ok,[{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(Pid,[s,r,m,p,c]),
  126:                 ok = dbg:c(dbg_test,test,[Config]),
  127:                 ok = dbg:i(),
  128:                 Pid ! {dbg_test, stop};
  129:             true ->
  130:                 ok=file:set_cwd(OldCurDir),
  131:                 ct:fail("Could not spawn external test process.~n"),
  132:                 failure
  133:         end
  134:     after
  135:         dbg:stop(),
  136:         ok = file:set_cwd(OldCurDir)
  137:     end,
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: %% Simple interface test with own handler
  141: simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  142:     try
  143:         start(),
  144:         dbg:p(self(),call),
  145:         dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[]),
  146:         dbg:ltp(),
  147:         stop(),
  148:         S = self(),
  149:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]}}] = flush()
  150:     after
  151:         dbg:stop()
  152:     end,
  153:     ok.
  154: 
  155: %% Simple interface test with pam code that appends a message
  156: message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  157:     {ok, _} = start(),
  158:     try
  159:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  160:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  161:         {value, {saved, Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  162:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg,ln,Saved),
  163:         {value, {saved, Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  164:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  165:         ok = dbg:ln()
  166:     after
  167:         dbg:stop()
  168:     end,
  169:     S = self(),
  170:     [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  171:      {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},S}] = flush(),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     {ok, _} = start(),
  176:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  177:     rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha,
  178:              [filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config))]),
  179:     try
  180:         Echo = fun F() ->
  181:                        receive {From, M} ->
  182:                                From ! M,
  183:                                F()
  184:                        end
  185:                end,
  186: 	Rcvr = spawn_link(Echo),
  187:         RemoteRcvr = spawn(Node, Echo),
  188: 
  189: 	{ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Rcvr, send),
  190: 
  191:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  192: 
  193:         %% Test that the test case process is the receiving process
  194:         send_test(Rcvr, [{[self(),'_'],[],[]}]),
  195: 
  196:         %% Test that self() is not the receiving process
  197:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}, {saved, 2}]} =
  198:             dbg:tpe(send, [{['$1','_'],[{'==','$1',{self}}],[]}]),
  199:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), false),
  200: 
  201:         %% Test that self() is the sending process
  202:         send_test(Rcvr, [{['_','_'],[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[]}]),
  203: 
  204:         %% Test attaching a message
  205:         send_test(Rcvr, [{['_','_'],[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[{message, hello}]}],
  206:                   make_ref(), hello),
  207: 
  208:         %% Test using a saved trace pattern
  209:         send_test(Rcvr, 2, make_ref(), false),
  210: 
  211:         %% Test clearing of trace pattern
  212:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:ctpe(send),
  213:         send_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  214: 
  215:         %% Test complex message inspection
  216:         Ref = make_ref(),
  217:         send_test(Rcvr,
  218:                   [{['_','$2'],[{'==',Ref,{element,1,{element,2,'$2'}}}],[]}],
  219:                   {test, {Ref}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, true),
  220: 
  221:         send_test(Rcvr, {test, {make_ref()}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, false),
  222: 
  223:         %% Test send to remote process
  224:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr, [], make_ref(), true),
  225: 
  226:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr,
  227:                          [{['$1','_'],[{'==',{node, '$1'},{node}}],[]}],
  228:                          make_ref(), false),
  229: 
  230:         remote_send_test(Rcvr, RemoteRcvr,
  231:                          [{['$1','_'],[{'==',{node, '$1'},Node}],[]}],
  232:                          make_ref(), true),
  233: 
  234:         %% Test that distributed dbg works
  235:         dbg:tracer(Node, process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  236:         Rcvr2 = spawn_link(Echo),
  237:         RemoteRcvr2 = spawn(Node, Echo),
  238:         dbg:p(Rcvr2, [send]),
  239:         dbg:p(RemoteRcvr2, [send]),
  240:         dbg:tpe(send, [{['_', hej],[],[]}]),
  241: 
  242:         send_test(Rcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  243:         send_test(RemoteRcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  244:         send_test(Rcvr2, hej, true),
  245:         send_test(RemoteRcvr2, hej, true),
  246: 
  247:         ok
  248: 
  249:     after
  250: 	dbg:stop(),
  251:         peer:stop(Peer)
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: send_test(Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  255:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, _]} = dbg:tpe(send, Pattern),
  256:     send_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent).
  257: send_test(Pid, Pattern) ->
  258:     send_test(Pid, Pattern, make_ref(), true).
  259: send_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  260:     S = self(),
  261:     Pid ! {S, Msg},
  262:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  263:     send_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, S, TraceEvent).
  264: 
  265: remote_send_test(Pid, RPid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  266:     dbg:tpe(send, Pattern),
  267:     TMsg = {self(), Msg},
  268:     Pid ! {RPid, TMsg},
  269:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  270:     send_test_rcv(Pid, TMsg, RPid, TraceEvent).
  271: 
  272: send_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, S, TraceEvent) ->
  273:     case flush() of
  274:         [] when not TraceEvent ->
  275:             ok;
  276:         [{trace, Pid, send, Msg, S}] when TraceEvent ->
  277:             ok;
  278:         [{trace, Pid, send, Msg, S, Message}] when TraceEvent == Message ->
  279:             ok;
  280:         Else ->
  281:             ct:fail({got_unexpected_message, Else})
  282:     end.
  283: 
  284: recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     {ok, _} = start(),
  286:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  287:     rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha,
  288:              [filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "..")]),
  289:     try
  290:         Echo = fun F() ->
  291:                        receive {From, M} ->
  292:                                From ! M,
  293:                                F()
  294:                        end
  295:                end,
  296: 	Rcvr = spawn_link(Echo),
  297:         RemoteRcvr = spawn(Node, Echo),
  298: 
  299: 	{ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Rcvr, 'receive'),
  300: 
  301:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  302: 
  303:         %% Test that the test case process is the sending process
  304:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{[node(), self(), '_'],[],[]}]),
  305: 
  306:         %% Test that self() is the not sending process
  307:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}, {saved, 2}]} =
  308:             dbg:tpe('receive', [{[node(), '$1','_'],[{'==','$1',{self}}],[]}]),
  309:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), false),
  310: 
  311:         %% Test that self() is the receiving process
  312:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{'_',[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[]}]),
  313: 
  314:         %% Test attaching a message
  315:         recv_test(Rcvr, [{'_',[{'==',Rcvr,{self}}],[{message, hello}]}],
  316:                   make_ref(), hello),
  317: 
  318:         %% Test using a saved trace pattern
  319:         recv_test(Rcvr, 2, make_ref(), false),
  320: 
  321:         %% Test clearing of trace pattern
  322:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:ctpe('receive'),
  323:         recv_test(Rcvr, make_ref(), true),
  324: 
  325:         %% Test complex message inspection
  326:         Ref = make_ref(),
  327:         recv_test(Rcvr,
  328:                   [{[node(), '_','$2'],[{'==',Ref,{element,1,
  329:                                                    {element,2,
  330:                                                     {element,2,'$2'}}}}],[]}],
  331:                   {test, {Ref}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, true),
  332: 
  333:         recv_test(Rcvr, {test, {make_ref()}, <<0:(8*1024)>>}, false),
  334: 
  335:         %% Test recv to remote process
  336:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr, [], make_ref(), true),
  337: 
  338:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr,
  339:                          [{['$1',undefined,'_'],[{'==','$1',{node}}],[]}],
  340:                          make_ref(), false),
  341: 
  342:         remote_recv_test(RemoteRcvr, Rcvr,
  343:                          [{['$1',undefined,'_'],[{'==','$1',Node}],[]}],
  344:                          make_ref(), true),
  345: 
  346:         %% Test that distributed dbg works
  347:         dbg:tracer(Node, process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  348:         Rcvr2 = spawn_link(Echo),
  349:         RemoteRcvr2 = spawn(Node, Echo),
  350:         dbg:p(Rcvr2, ['receive']),
  351:         dbg:p(RemoteRcvr2, ['receive']),
  352:         dbg:tpe('receive', [{[node(), '_', '$1'],[{'==',{element,2,'$1'}, hej}],[]}]),
  353: 
  354:         recv_test(Rcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  355:         recv_test(RemoteRcvr2, make_ref(), false),
  356:         recv_test(Rcvr2, hej, true),
  357:         recv_test(RemoteRcvr2, hej, true),
  358: 
  359:         ok
  360: 
  361:     after
  362: 	dbg:stop(),
  363:         peer:stop(Peer)
  364:     end.
  365: 
  366: recv_test(Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  367:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, _]} = dbg:tpe('receive', Pattern),
  368:     recv_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent).
  369: recv_test(Pid, Pattern) ->
  370:     recv_test(Pid, Pattern, make_ref(), true).
  371: recv_test(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  372:     S = self(),
  373:     Pid ! {S, Msg},
  374:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  375:     recv_test_rcv(Pid, {S, Msg}, TraceEvent).
  376: 
  377: remote_recv_test(RPid, Pid, Pattern, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  378:     dbg:tpe('receive', Pattern),
  379:     TMsg = {self(), Msg},
  380:     RPid ! {Pid, TMsg},
  381:     receive Msg -> ok end,
  382:     recv_test_rcv(Pid, TMsg, TraceEvent).
  383: 
  384: recv_test_rcv(Pid, Msg, TraceEvent) ->
  385:     case flush() of
  386:         [] when not TraceEvent ->
  387:             ok;
  388:         [{trace, Pid, 'receive', Msg}] when TraceEvent ->
  389:             ok;
  390:         [{trace, Pid, 'receive', Msg, Message}] when TraceEvent == Message ->
  391:             ok;
  392:         Else ->
  393:             ct:fail({got_unexpected_message, Else})
  394:     end.
  395: 
  396: %% Simple test of distributed tracing
  397: distributed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     {ok, _} = start(),
  399:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  400:     try
  401:         RexPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [rex]),
  402:         RexPidList = pid_to_list(RexPid),
  403:         {ok, Node} = dbg:n(Node),
  404:         {ok, X} = dbg:p(all,call),
  405:         {value, {matched, Node, _}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, X),
  406:         {ok, Y} = dbg:p(RexPidList, s),
  407:         {value, {matched, Node, 1}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, Y),
  408:         {ok, Z} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,[]),
  409:         {value, {matched, Node, 1}} = lists:keysearch(Node, 2, Z),
  410:         dbg:cn(Node),
  411:         dbg:tp(dbg,ln,[]),
  412:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  413:         [ok = rpc:block_call(Node, dbg, ltp, []) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  414:         ok = rpc:block_call(Node, dbg, ln, []),
  415:         S = self(),
  416:         {TraceSend, TraceCall} =
  417:         lists:partition(fun ({trace,RP,send,_,_}) when RP =:= RexPid -> true;
  418:                             (_) -> false end,
  419:                         flush()),
  420:         [_|_] = TraceSend,
  421:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]}} | RemoteCall] = TraceCall,
  422:         100 = length(RemoteCall),
  423:         [{trace,Pid,call,{dbg,ltp,[]}}] = lists:uniq(RemoteCall),
  424:         Node = node(Pid),
  425:         %%
  426:         stop()
  427:     after
  428:         dbg:stop(),
  429:         peer:stop(Peer)
  430:     end,
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: 
  434: %% Tests tracing of local function calls.
  435: local_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  436:     {ok, _} = start(),
  437:     try
  438:         S = self(),
  439:         %% Split "<X.Y.Z>" into {X, Y, Z}
  440:         "<"++L1 = L = pid_to_list(S),
  441:         NoDot = fun ($.) -> false; (_) -> true end,
  442:         {LX,"."++L2} = lists:splitwith(NoDot, L1),
  443:         {LY,"."++L3} = lists:splitwith(NoDot, L2),
  444:         ">"++L4 = lists:reverse(L3),
  445:         LZ = lists:reverse(L4),
  446:         X = 0 = list_to_integer(LX),
  447:         Y = list_to_integer(LY),
  448:         Z = list_to_integer(LZ),
  449:         XYZ = {X, Y, Z},
  450:         io:format("Self = ~w = ~w~n", [S,XYZ]),
  451:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(S,call),
  452:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(XYZ,call),
  453:         if Z =:= 0 ->
  454:                {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(Y,call);
  455:            true -> ok
  456:         end,
  457:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(L,call),
  458:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,[]),
  459:         4 = not_exported(2),
  460:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,not_exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  461:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE,exported,[]),
  462:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  463:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,exported,[2]}},
  464:          {trace,S,call,{?MODULE,not_exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  465:         {ok, _} = dbg:ctpl(?MODULE),
  466:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  467:         [{trace,S,call,{?MODULE,exported,[2]}}] = flush(),
  468:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,[]),
  469:         {ok, _} = dbg:ctp(?MODULE),
  470:         4 = ?MODULE:exported(2),
  471:         [] = flush(),
  472:         {ok, _} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,not_exported,x),
  473:         catch ?MODULE:exported(x),
  474:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg_SUITE,not_exported,[x]}},
  475:          {trace,S,exception_from,
  476:           {dbg_SUITE,not_exported,1},
  477:           {error,badarith}}] = flush()
  478:     after
  479:         dbg:stop()
  480:     end,
  481:     ok.
  482: 
  483: %% Test that tracing on port works
  484: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  485:     try
  486:         S = self(),
  487:         start(),
  488:         TestFile = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),"port_test"),
  489:         Fun = dbg:trace_port(file, TestFile),
  490: 
  491:         %% Do a run to get rid of all extra port operations
  492:         port_close(Fun()),
  493: 
  494:         dbg:p(new_ports,ports),
  495:         Port = Fun(),
  496:         port_close(Port),
  497:         stop(),
  498: 
  499:         TraceFileDrv = list_to_atom(lists:flatten(["trace_file_drv n ",TestFile])),
  500:         [{trace,Port,open,S,TraceFileDrv},
  501:          {trace,Port,getting_linked,S},
  502:          {trace,Port,closed,normal}] = flush()
  503:     after
  504:         dbg:stop()
  505:     end,
  506:     ok.
  507: 
  508: %% Tests saving of match_spec's.
  509: saved_patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  510:     dbg:stop(),
  511:     {ok,[{saved,1}]} =
  512:     dbg:tp(dbg,ctp,1,[{'_',[],[{message, blahonga}]}]),
  513:     {ok,[{saved,2}]} =
  514:     dbg:tp(dbg,ctp,1,[{['_'],[],[{message, blahonga}]}]),
  515:     Privdir=proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  516:     file:make_dir(Privdir),
  517:     File = filename:join([Privdir, "blahonga.ms"]),
  518:     dbg:wtp(File),
  519:     dbg:stop(),
  520:     dbg:ctp('_','_','_'),
  521:     {ok, _} = start(),
  522:     try
  523:         dbg:rtp(File),
  524:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1},{saved,1}]} = dbg:tp(dbg,ltp,0,1),
  525:         {ok, [{matched, _, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  526:         dbg:ltp(),
  527:         S = self(),
  528:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},blahonga}] = flush()
  529:     after
  530:         dbg:stop()
  531:     end,
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: 
  535: 
  536: not_exported(N) ->
  537:     N * 2.
  538: 
  539: exported(N) ->
  540:     not_exported(N).
  541: 
  542: %% Test tracing to IP port
  543: ip_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  544:     stop(),
  545:     Port = dbg:trace_port(ip, 0),
  546:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  547:     try
  548:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  549:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  550:         {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  551:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  552:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  553:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  554:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  555:         {ok, IpPort} = dbg:trace_port_control(get_listen_port),
  556:         io:format("IpPort = ~p~n", [IpPort]),
  557:         dbg:trace_client(ip, IpPort, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  558:         S = self(),
  559:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  560:          {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej}] = flush()
  561:     after
  562:         dbg:stop()
  563:     end,
  564:     ok.
  565: 
  566: 
  567: 
  568: %% Test that the dbg server does not hang if the tracer don't start (OTP-3592)
  569: ip_port_busy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  570:     stop(),
  571:     Tracer = dbg:trace_port(ip, 4745),
  572:     Port = Tracer(),
  573:     {error, Reason} = dbg:tracer(port, Tracer),
  574:     try
  575:         io:format("Error reason = ~p~n", [Reason]),
  576:         true = port_close(Port)
  577:     after
  578:         dbg:stop()
  579:     end,
  580:     ok.
  581: 
  582: %% Test tracing to file port (simple)
  583: file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     stop(),
  585:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  586:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, FName),
  587:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  588:     try
  589:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  590:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  591:         {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  592:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  593:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  594:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  595:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  596:         stop(),
  597:         dbg:trace_client(file, FName, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  598:         S = self(),
  599:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S},
  600:          {trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej},
  601:          end_of_trace] = flush()
  602:     after
  603:         dbg:stop(),
  604:         file:delete(FName)
  605:     end,
  606:     ok.
  607: 
  608: %% Test tracing to file port with 'follow_file'
  609: file_port2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  610:     stop(),
  611:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  612:     %% Ok, lets try with flush and follow_file.
  613:     Port2 = dbg:trace_port(file, FName),
  614:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port2),
  615:     try
  616:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  617:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  618:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  619:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  620:         ok = dbg:flush_trace_port(),
  621:         dbg:trace_client(follow_file, FName,
  622:                          {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  623:         S = self(),
  624:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ltp,[]},S}] = flush(),
  625:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  626:         ok = dbg:flush_trace_port(),
  627:         receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Polls every second...
  628:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,ln,[]},hej}] = flush(),
  629:         stop(),
  630:         [] = flush()
  631:     after
  632:         dbg:stop(),
  633:         file:delete(FName)
  634:     end,
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: %% Test tracing to file
  638: file_tracer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  639:     stop(),
  640:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  641:     %% Ok, lets try with flush and follow_file.
  642:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file, FName),
  643:     try
  644:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  645:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ltp,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  646:         {ok, _} = dbg:tp(dbg, ln, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  647:         ok = dbg:ltp(),
  648:         timer:sleep(100),
  649:         {ok, LTP} = file:read_file(FName),
  650:         <<"dbg:ltp()",_/binary>> = string:find(LTP, "dbg:ltp() ("++pid_to_list(self())++")"),
  651:         ok = dbg:ln(),
  652:         timer:sleep(100),
  653:         {ok, LN} = file:read_file(FName),
  654:         <<"dbg:ln()",_/binary>> = string:find(LN, "dbg:ln() (hej)"),
  655:         stop()
  656:     after
  657:         dbg:stop(),
  658:         file:delete(FName)
  659:     end,
  660:     ok.
  661: 
  662: %% Test tracing to wrapping file port
  663: wrap_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     Self = self(),
  665:     stop(),
  666:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  667:     FNameWildcard = FName ++ "*" ++ ".trace",
  668:     %% WrapSize=0 and WrapCnt=11 will force the trace to wrap after
  669:     %% every trace message, and to contain only the last 10 entries
  670:     %% after trace stop since the last file will be empty waiting
  671:     %% for its first trace message.
  672:     WrapSize = 0,
  673:     WrapCnt = 11,
  674:     WrapFilesSpec = {FName, wrap, ".trace", WrapSize, WrapCnt},
  675:     wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec),
  676:     %% The number of iterations, N, is tested to place wrap the log,
  677:     %% giving a gap in the filename sequence at index 3.
  678:     %% This should be a difficult case for
  679:     %% the trace_client file sorting functionality.
  680:     N = 7,
  681:     lists:foreach(
  682:       fun(Cnt) ->
  683:               ?MODULE:tracee1(Cnt),
  684:               ?MODULE:tracee2(Cnt)
  685:       end,
  686:       lists:seq(1, N)),
  687:     stop(),
  688:     try
  689:         Files1 = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  690:         io:format("~p~n", [Files1]),
  691:         Tc1 = dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec,
  692:                                {fun myhandler/2, {wait_for_go,Self}}),
  693:         Tref1 = erlang:monitor(process, Tc1),
  694:         Tc1 ! {go,Self},
  695:         [{'DOWN',Tref1,_,_,normal},
  696:          end_of_trace
  697:          |Result] = lists:reverse(flush()),
  698:         M = N - (WrapCnt-1) div 2,
  699:         M = wrap_port_result(Result, Self, N),
  700:         %%
  701:         %% Start a new wrap log with the same name to verify that
  702:         %% all files are cleared at wrap log start. Only produce
  703:         %% two trace messages to also place the gap at index 3,
  704:         %% so the trace log will be misinterpreted.
  705:         %%
  706:         wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec),
  707:         Files2 = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  708:         io:format("~p~n", [Files2]),
  709:         -1 = ?MODULE:tracee1(-1),
  710:         -1 = ?MODULE:tracee2(-1),
  711:         stop(),
  712:         Files = filelib:wildcard(FNameWildcard),
  713:         io:format("~p~n", [Files]),
  714:         Tc2 = dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec,
  715:                                {fun myhandler/2, {wait_for_go,Self}}),
  716:         Tref2 = erlang:monitor(process, Tc2),
  717:         Tc2 ! {go,Self},
  718:         [{trace,Self,call,{?MODULE,tracee1,[-1]},Self},
  719:          {trace,Self,call,{?MODULE,tracee2,[-1]},hej},
  720:          end_of_trace,
  721:          {'DOWN',Tref2,_,_,normal}] = flush(),
  722:         %%
  723:         lists:map(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files)
  724:     after
  725:         dbg:stop()
  726:     end,
  727:     ok.
  728: 
  729: wrap_port_init(WrapFilesSpec) ->
  730:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, WrapFilesSpec),
  731:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  732:     {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  733:     {ok, X} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee1,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  734:     {value, {saved, _Saved}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  735:     {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee2, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  736:     {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  737:     ok.
  738: 
  739: tracee1(X) ->
  740:     X.
  741: 
  742: tracee2(X) ->
  743:     X.
  744: 
  745: wrap_port_result([], _S, M) ->
  746:     M;
  747: wrap_port_result([{trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [M]}, hej},
  748:                   {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [M]}, S} | Tail],
  749:                  S,
  750:                  M) ->
  751:     wrap_port_result(Tail, S, M-1).
  752: 
  753: 
  754: %% Test tracing to time limited wrapping file port
  755: wrap_port_time(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     stop(),
  757:     FName = make_temp_name(Config),
  758:     %% WrapTime=2 and WrapCnt=4 will force the trace to wrap after
  759:     %% every 2 seconds, and to contain between 3*2 and 4*2 seconds
  760:     %% of trace entries.
  761:     WrapFilesSpec = {FName, wrap, ".trace", {time, 2000}, 4},
  762:     Port = dbg:trace_port(file, WrapFilesSpec),
  763:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(port, Port),
  764:     try
  765:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  766:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee1,[{'_',[],[{message, {self}}]}]),
  767:         {value, {saved, _Saved1}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  768:         {ok, Y} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, tracee2, [{'_',[],[{message, hej}]}]),
  769:         {value, {saved, _Saved2}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, Y),
  770:         %% The delays in the iterations places two trace messages in each
  771:         %% trace file, but the last which is empty waiting for its first
  772:         %% trace message. The number of iterations is chosen so that
  773:         %% one trace file has been wasted, and therefore the first pair
  774:         %% of trace messages.
  775:         lists:foreach(
  776:           fun(Cnt) ->
  777:                   receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  778:                   ?MODULE:tracee1(Cnt),
  779:                   ?MODULE:tracee2(Cnt),
  780:                   receive after 1100 -> ok end
  781:           end,
  782:           lists:seq(1, 4)),
  783:         stop(),
  784:         Files = filelib:wildcard(FName ++ "*" ++ ".trace"),
  785:         io:format("~p~n", [Files]),
  786:         dbg:trace_client(file, WrapFilesSpec, {fun myhandler/2, self()}),
  787:         S = self(),
  788:         [{trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [2]}, S},
  789:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [2]}, hej},
  790:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [3]}, S},
  791:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [3]}, hej},
  792:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee1, [4]}, S},
  793:          {trace, S, call, {?MODULE, tracee2, [4]}, hej},
  794:          end_of_trace] = flush(),
  795:         lists:map(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files)
  796:     after
  797:         dbg:stop()
  798:     end,
  799:     ok.
  800: 
  801: %% Test ordinary tracing combined with seq_trace
  802: with_seq_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  803:     try
  804:         {ok, Server} = start(),
  805:         {ok, Tracer} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  806:         {ok, X} = dbg:tp(dbg, get_tracer, [{[],[],
  807:                                             [{set_seq_token, send, true}]}]),
  808:         {value, {saved, _}} = lists:keysearch(saved, 1, X),
  809:         {ok, [{matched, _node, 1}]} = dbg:p(self(),call),
  810:         seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Tracer),
  811:         dbg:get_tracer(),
  812:         receive
  813:         after 1 ->
  814:                   ok
  815:         end,
  816:         S = self(),
  817:         ThisNode = node(),
  818:         [{trace,S,call,{dbg,get_tracer,[]}},
  819:          {seq_trace,0,{send,_,S,Server,{S,{get_tracer,ThisNode}}}},
  820:          {seq_trace,0,{send,_,Server,S,{dbg,{ok,Tracer}}}}] =
  821:         flush()
  822:     after
  823:         dbg:stop()
  824:     end,
  825:     ok.
  826: 
  827: 
  828: %% Test that trace messages concerning a now dead process does not crash dbg.
  829: dead_suspend(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  830:     start(),
  831:     try
  832:         survived = run_dead_suspend()
  833:     after
  834:         dbg:stop()
  835:     end.
  836: 
  837: run_dead_suspend() ->
  838:     dbg:p(new, call),
  839:     dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  840:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  841:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  842:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  843:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  844:     spawn(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  845:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  846:     case whereis(dbg) of
  847:         undefined ->
  848:             died;
  849:         _ ->
  850:             survived
  851:     end.
  852: 
  853: dummy() ->
  854:     ok.
  855: 
  856: %% Test that a tracer process does not ignore an exit signal message when it has
  857: %% received (but not handled) trace messages
  858: tracer_exit_on_stop(_) ->
  859:     %% Tracer blocks waiting for fun to complete so that the trace message and
  860:     %% the exit signal message from the dbg process are in its message queue.
  861:     Fun = fun() ->
  862:                   ?MODULE:dummy(),
  863:                   Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(self()),
  864:                   receive {trace_delivered, _, Ref} -> stop() end
  865:           end,
  866:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun spawn_once_handler/2, {self(), Fun}}),
  867:     {ok, Tracer} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  868:     MRef = monitor(process, Tracer),
  869:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(self(), [call]),
  870:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(new, [call]),
  871:     {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  872:     ?MODULE:dummy(),
  873:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, normal} -> ok end,
  874:     [{trace,_,call,{?MODULE, dummy,[]}},
  875:      {trace,_,call,{?MODULE, dummy,[]}}] = flush(),
  876:     ok.
  877: 
  878: spawn_once_handler(Event, {Pid, done} = State) ->
  879:     Pid ! Event,
  880:     State;
  881: spawn_once_handler(Event, {Pid, Fun}) ->
  882:     {_, Ref} = spawn_monitor(Fun),
  883:     receive
  884:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} ->
  885:             Pid ! Event,
  886:             {Pid, done}
  887:     end.
  888: 
  889: %% Test that erl_tracer modules work correctly
  890: erl_tracer(Config) ->
  891:     stop(),
  892: 
  893:     ok = load_nif(Config),
  894: 
  895:     Self = self(),
  896:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(module, {?MODULE, Self}),
  897:     {ok, {?MODULE, Self}} = dbg:get_tracer(),
  898:     {ok, _} = dbg:p(self(), [c, timestamp]),
  899:     {ok, _} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  900:     ok = ?MODULE:dummy(),
  901:     [{Self, call, Self, Self, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  902:     ok.
  903: 
  904: %% Test that distributed erl_tracer modules work
  905: distributed_erl_tracer(Config) ->
  906:     stop(),
  907: 
  908:     S = self(),
  909: 
  910:     ok = load_nif(Config),
  911: 
  912:     LNode = node(),
  913:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  914:     true = rpc:call(RNode, code, add_patha, [filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "..")]),
  915:     ok = rpc:call(RNode, ?MODULE, load_nif, [Config]),
  916: 
  917:     NifProxy = fun() ->
  918:                        register(nif_proxy, self()),
  919:                        receive M -> S ! M end
  920:                end,
  921: 
  922:     LNifProxy = spawn_link(LNode, NifProxy),
  923:     RNifProxy = spawn_link(RNode, NifProxy),
  924: 
  925:     TracerFun = fun() -> {?MODULE, whereis(nif_proxy)} end,
  926: 
  927:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(LNode, module, TracerFun),
  928:     {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(RNode, module, TracerFun),
  929: 
  930:     {ok, [{matched, _, _}, {matched, _, _}]} = dbg:p(all,c),
  931:     {ok, [_, _]} = dbg:tp(?MODULE, dummy, []),
  932: 
  933:     {ok, {?MODULE, LNifProxy}} = dbg:get_tracer(LNode),
  934:     {ok, {?MODULE, RNifProxy}} = dbg:get_tracer(RNode),
  935: 
  936:     LCall = spawn_link(LNode, fun() -> ?MODULE:dummy() end),
  937:     [{LCall, call, LNifProxy, LCall, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  938: 
  939:     RCall = spawn_link(RNode, fun() -> ?MODULE:dummy() end),
  940:     [{RCall, call, RNifProxy, RCall, {?MODULE, dummy, []}, #{}}] = flush(),
  941: 
  942:     peer:stop(Peer),
  943:     ok.
  944: 
  945: load_nif(Config) ->
  946:     SoFile = atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  947:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  948:     case erlang:load_nif(filename:join(DataDir, SoFile) , 0) of
  949:         {error, {reload, _}} ->
  950:             ok;
  951:         ok ->
  952:             ok
  953:     end.
  954: 
  955: enabled(_, _, _) ->
  956:     erlang:nif_error(nif_not_loaded).
  957: 
  958: trace(_, _, _, _, _) ->
  959:     erlang:nif_error(nif_not_loaded).
  960: 
  961: %%
  962: %% Support functions
  963: %%
  964: 
  965: myhandler(Message, {wait_for_go,Pid}) ->
  966:     receive
  967:         {go,Pid} ->
  968:             myhandler(Message, Pid)
  969:     end;
  970: myhandler(Message, Relay) ->
  971:     Relay ! Message,
  972:     case Message of
  973:         end_of_trace ->
  974:             ok;
  975:         _ ->
  976:             Relay
  977:     end.
  978: 
  979: flush() ->
  980:     flush([]).
  981: flush(Acc) ->
  982:     receive
  983:         X ->
  984:             flush(Acc ++ [X])
  985:     after 1000 ->
  986:               Acc
  987:     end.
  988: 
  989: start() ->
  990:     stop(),
  991:     dbg:tracer(process, {fun myhandler/2, self()}).
  992: 
  993: stop() ->
  994:     dbg:stop().
  995: 
  996: make_temp_name(Config) ->
  997:     {A,B,C} = erlang:timestamp(),
  998:     FTMP = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ integer_to_list(A) ++ "-" ++
  999:     integer_to_list(B) ++ "-" ++ integer_to_list(C),
 1000:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), FTMP).
